[[Legion of Merit]] ([[United States]]) |laterwork= }} [[General (Australia)|General]] '''Sir John Gordon Noel Wilton''' [[Knight Commander of the Order of the British Empire|KBE]], [[Companion of the Order of the Bath|CB]], [[Companion of the Distinguished Service Order|DSO]] (22 November 1910 – 10 May 1981) was the most senior military figure in Australia from May 1966 to November 1970. ==Early career== On graduation from [[Royal Military College Duntroon]], Wilton was commissioned as a [[second lieutenant]] in the [[British Army]]'s [[Royal Artillery]] on 9 December 1930 (with seniority from 22 November).{{LondonGazette |issue=33701 |startpage=1988 |date=24 March 1931 |accessdate=2008-11-05}} ''(Commissioned)'' Having returned to the Australian forces, he was awarded the [[Distinguished Service Order]] (DSO) on 27 April 1944 serving in the South West Pacific in the [[Second World War]].{{LondonGazette |issue=36486 |supp=yes |startpage=1927 |date=25 April 1944 |accessdate=2008-11-05}} ''(DSO)'' For his war service he was subsequently appointed an [[Officer of the Order of the British Empire]] (OBE) on 6 March 1947.{{LondonGazette |issue=37898 |supp=yes |startpage=1086 |date=4 March 1947 |accessdate=2008-11-05}} ''(OBE)'' Post-war he was appointed [[Companion of the Order of the Bath]] (CB) in the 1962 [[Queen's Birthday Honours]],{{LondonGazette |issue=42684 |startpage=4343 |date=25 May 1962 |accessdate=2008-11-05}} ''(CB)'' and appointed [[Knight Commander of the Order of the British Empire]] (KBE) in the 1964 [[New Year Honours]].{{LondonGazette |issue=43201 |supp=yes |startpage=36 |date=31 December 1963 |accessdate=2008-11-05}} ''(KBE)'' ==Later appointments== * January 1963 – May 1966 [[Chief of Army
